data.title: Nice Staff, Forgettable Food
data.text: We moved to the area late last year and early on dropped into Wong's JR to spare ourselves the work of making dinner and cleaning up on top of getting settled into our new home. When we entered, the place looked nice enough - comfortable, clean. The staff behind the counter were prompt to greet us, and encouraged us to take counter seats while we looked the menu over. Everyone who left the kitchen greeted us in a friendly manner. We made our orders, brought them home, and dug in. I believe I got the Orange Chicken, I'm not sure what my husband chose. Unfortunately, neither of us was impressed with our meals. My chicken was sliced thin and a bit dry or tough, and his food was rather bland. The only memorable thing about our meals turns out to be how disappointing they were. I was really hoping to enjoy their food, they're in the perfect location for us, but even for a Phoenician it's impossible for me to recommend them to anyone. Their staff was terrific, but their kitchen needs new recipes or better prep practices. When we're in the mood for Chinese, we've chosen to head further East on Peoria road, instead.

data.title: I Can No Longer Recommend
data.text:
I left a previous review that I wanted to update,  but wasn't able to so here's a new one. 

After eating here frequently for years,  I was greeted at the door and told I could not eat there with my service dog, who has been with me every other time.  I was told that they had three or four complaints about service dogs, not mine specifically, but service dogs in general.   They will no longer allow service dogs. I explained the law,  to no avail.   I explained that my dog is professionally trained,  specifically for me.   I explained that my life is dependent on the dog.   Nope.  Not letting me eat there with my nine pound dog that warns me of an impending, life-threatening  health crisis.  I was welcome to eat there without the dog, but no dog.  

I really tried for an enlightening conversation and figured not everyone is versed in the Americans with Disabilities Act, hoping we could come to an understanding.  Unfortunately,  not.   Of course I know they've broken the law and there is recourse,  but I did want folks to know that not everyone is welcomed at this establishment.

data.title: Good noodles but the orange chicken....
data.text: I had take out from here. I was told it was average as Chinese food goes. I had the orange chicken and noodles. They were the soft noodles. The noodles were actually pretty good. I thought that the orange chicken was horrible. It was poorly breaded and the chicken was tough. The sauce was like a weird sweet and sour sauce. Probably the worst orange chicken I have ever had. The egg roll I had was average. I have not been to the restaurant, but I don't think I will be going either.

data.title: Family Favorite
data.text: This is one of our favorite places - we often order for delivery and they are so quick.  Our family favorites are the Mongolian Beef, Lo Mein, and the Wongs Spicy Chicken.

data.title: Don't waste your money
data.text: Food always is dry, tastes old have not gone back after trying various times. The service is poor as well so it is a fail.

data.title: Best Chinese in the Local area.
data.text: Any time I go here the food is always hot and fresh, it is cooked to each order. I love the House Chicken not so sweet and I get extra sauce to dip my my egg roll in. I always go to lunch. Perfect serving size portions.  Their Egg Drop Soup is the bomb. I even order just a big bowl of soup on rainy cool days.  On special events I take my family here for 12 people lunch with appetizers and drinks $150.00 including tip. Really cheap.

data.title: What Happened?
data.text: I had been going to Wong's Jr for a couple of years until recently. I don't know what happened, but the food went from pretty good to awful. The last time we went, my husband ordered a House Egg Foo Yung, and I got Chicken Chow Mein. The Egg Foo Yung was an unidentifiable disk of something that just tasted really BAD. My chicken was UNDERCOOKED to the point of being RAW in some places. I had previously ordered delivery food where the shrimp dishes were undercooked (RAW) and I had to finish cooking the meal. I also got very sick the last time we ate their food. Unfortunately, I will not eat there again, which is too bad because the owner is a nice guy. We have since found other places to get our Chinese food fix.

data.title: Not bad, not great
data.text: We had delivery last night.  Wong, Jr. was recommended to us, but it's obvious we don't have the same tastes.  I'm used to wor wonton soup being very flavorful and chockfull of veggies, pork, chicken, shrimp and wontons.  Not here.  It was watery and chockfull of very little.  The two dishes we bought -- kung pao vegetables and garlic chicken were two more disappointments.  They didn't necessarily taste bad, but they tasted exactly the same, but one had chicken. While I'm not going to say, "stay away", but if you love Chinese food, maybe you should go elsewhere.  Otherwise, it's just ok.
